snippet: China will almost certainly join the United States in supporting tougher sanctions for Pyongyang over Tuesday’s  test, accompanied by sterner reprimands from Beijing.
abstract: China is expected to join United States in supporting tougher sanctions for North Korea over its latest nuclear arms test.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and JANE PERLEZ
byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from the United Nations, and Jane Perlez from Beijing. David E. Sanger contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: China will almost certainly join the United States in supporting tougher sanctions for Pyongyang over Tuesday’s  test, accompanied by sterner reprimands from Beijing.

headline.seo: China Looms Over Response to Blast Test by North Korea
headline.main: China Looms Over Response to Nuclear Test by North Korea
headline.print_headline: China Looms Over Response to Blast Test by North Korea

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
